revised_title: The Ancon Sheep Breed: A Unique Variety in Sheep Breeds
tldr: The article discusses the unique characteristics and history of the Ancon sheep breed, which has short legs and long backs. These sheep were initially bred in America and were expected to be valuable due to their inability to jump fences. However, they have some disadvantages, such as difficulty in driving them to market and smaller, less saleable carcasses. The author also mentions the decline of the Ancon breed due to the introduction of Merinos, which are better feeders and have higher-quality fleeces.
